definitions: To move by hopping lightly on one foot and then the other.
To omit or leave out (something, especially a part of a series or sequence).
To jump over (a rope) in the game of skip rope.
To pass quickly from one subject to another.
To avoid or miss (a duty, event, or class).
examples: She skipped happily down the path.
He skipped the difficult questions on the test.
The children skipped rope in the yard.
The conversation skipped from one topic to another.
I skipped class to go to the concert.
